title: The Racket: A Rogue Reporter vs. the American Elite (2E 2016)

The Racket: A Rogue Reporter vs. the American Elite (2nd Edition) by Matt Kennard
English | ISBN: 1780329873 | 2016 | EPUB | 343 pages | 603.16 KB

The author, a former Financial Times journalist, goes on to write about how the â€œcountervailing powers, such as strong organised labor groups, that previously had some check on business power have been eroded and fracturedâ€ and how today big business can, â€œlike never before, write laws, weaken and destroy labor rights and the environment and control the mediaâ€. â€œThe Racketâ€, as he calls it, is, at least for the moment, calling the shots.

Kennard chronicles the rise and excesses of corporate power in the contemporary world, but this is also a book about resistance. He describes how he was leaving a Palestinian village in Hebron when he saw â€œan IDF soldier kicking a Palestinian man. I got the taxi to stop and got out. I donâ€™t know what effect it had, but you could see a change in the eyes of the soldiers when they saw my camera pointing their way.â€

From Haiti to Bolivia, from Columbia to Palestine, from Turkey to Honduras, from Mexico to Egypt, from South Africa to Chile, he reports on the â€œRacketâ€ and on the fightback. And then back to the US, to Washington DC itself, where, early in 2011, he heard about â€œa sit-in at the Bank of Americaâ€ and left the FT offices to go and see what was going on.

For ordinary Americans there has been no economic recovery since 2008. Indeed, as he points out, median wages in the US have been falling since 2006. Michael Greenstone of the Brooking Institute tells him that in real terms American male workers are â€œback to where they were in the 1950s. I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s been a period in American history where youâ€™ve seen such a large, systemic, long-term decline.â€
